introduction: This video discusses the reasons why selecting all columns (star) from a table in a relational database can be slow. It explores the concept of pages in a database and how reading data from a page involves multiple operations, including file system and ssd mapping. The video also explains how the database caches data in shared buffers for faster access.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding Pages in Databases
content: Explanation of how database pages are organized and stored in a file.
Discussion of fixed-size pages and their importance in reading data.
Explanation of how page numbers and sizes are determined.
Example of reading a page from a file.

sections.title: Section 2: Reading Data from a Page
content: Explanation of how the database reads data from a page in a file.
Discussion of file system and ssd mapping in the process.
Explanation of how the operating system converts raw bytes to blocks.
Example of reading a single page from a file.

sections.title: Section 3: Caching Data in Shared Buffers
content: Explanation of how the database caches data in shared buffers for faster access.
Discussion of the importance of shared memory in the caching process.
Example of how a database process reads data from shared memory.
Explanation of how the database manages shared memory.

sections.title: Section 4: Complexity of Selecting All Columns
content: Explanation of the potential complexity of selecting all columns (star) from a table.
Discussion of how the database must perform a full table scan to retrieve all columns.
Explanation of the impact of table size and indexes on performance.
Example of a full table scan in action.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion and Future Discussion
content: Summary of the key points discussed in the video.
Explanation of how understanding database performance can impact development.
Suggestions for future discussion on database optimization.
Call to action for viewers to apply the concepts learned.
